clinical_study.brief_title: SUBclavian Central Venous Catheters Guidance and Examination by UltraSound
clinical_study.official_title: SUBclavian Central Venous Catheters Guidance and Examination by UltraSound : a Randomized Controlled Study Versus Landmark Method

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, randomized controlled clinical unicentric study, in ICU, Cannulation of the subclavian venous and examination guided with ultrasound

detailed_description.textblock: One groupe : Ultrasound guided for cannulation and examination of absence ofcomplications One groupe : landmark method and examination with chest radiography

primary_outcome.measure: procedure time between the beginning of procedure ( TO) and when the catheter is controlled ( T4) between strategy catheter cannulation 'standard' and a strategy called "ultrasound all

secondary_outcome.measure: procedure time Tn-Tn (n 0-5) between the two strategies.
incidence of occurrence of complications: pneumothorax, hemothorax, bad positioning (outside of the superior vena cava or the right atrium) between the two strategies
failure of technology between the two strategies.
occurrence of central venous catheter infection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adults patients
- requiring subclavian vein cannulation
- patient covered by french health care system
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient refusal
- requiring vein cannulation femoral or jugular
- we see nothing with echocardiography
- children and not adult patients
